title: Bicycle
content: A bicycle, also called a pedal cycle, bike, push-bike or cycle, is a human-powered or motor-assisted, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, with two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other.

title: Skateboard
content: A skateboard is a type of sports equipment used for skateboarding. It is usually made of a specially designed 7â€“8-ply maple plywood deck and has polyurethane wheels attached to the underside by a pair of skateboarding trucks.

title: Swimming
content: Swimming is a popular recreational activity and competitive sport that involves moving through water using various techniques. It offers numerous health benefits and is suitable for people of all ages and fitness levels.

title: Boxing
content: Boxing is a combat sport and a martial art[1] in which two people, usually wearing protective gloves and other protective equipment such as hand wraps and mouthguards, throw punches at each other for a predetermined amount of time in a boxing ring.

title: Yoga
content: Yoga is a group of physical, mental, and spiritual practices or disciplines which originated in ancient India and aim to control (yoke) and still the mind, recognizing a detached witness-consciousness untouched by the mind and mundane suffering.
